Harry Guajan

Harry Guajan

My name is Harry Nicol√°s Guajan Simbana, and I'm currently pursuing a degree in Computer Engineering at the National Polytechnic School of Ecuador (EPN). This program has provided me with strong foundations in programming, database systems, and development tools while motivating me to explore emerging fields in computing. I remain committed to continuous learning, striving to enhance both my technical skills and problem-solving capabilities.

I was born and raised in Quito, Ecuador, a city that has offered me exceptional opportunities for personal and academic growth. Since childhood, I've demonstrated keen interest in technology and creative disciplines, which I now channel into projects combining logical structure, thoughtful design, and practical functionality. I strongly believe in maintaining balance between technical excellence and human-centered approaches when developing accessible solutions.

Currently in my fourth semester, I'm particularly focused on software and application development, working extensively with Java and Python. I'm passionate about creating tools that can meaningfully improve people's lives, and I thrive on the challenge of transforming conceptual ideas into purposeful, functional projects.

Software Development: backend development, application design, productivity tools
Programming Languages: Java, Python
Creative Technologies: digital illustration, storytelling, comic creation
Multimedia Tools: graphic design, media editing

Projects

POLITUTI Store Management System: CRUD-based management interface.
[Completed (October 2024)]
Harry Guajan, Michael Yanez, Lenin Vasquez
[PDF] | [CODE]
Abstract: Developed a complete retail management system for my Computer Engineering program at EPN, integrating Java Swing with MySQL to handle product inventory, customer data, and invoice generation. The system features data validation, PDF invoice automation, and an optimized user interface. His academic project demonstrates object-oriented programming proficiency through its relational database schema (designed with UML), solving technical challenges like invoice code generation and document printing. Key achievements include implementing search filters, data integrity constraints for critical operations, and iterative UI/UX improvements. The system serves as a practical application of core Java concepts, database connectivity, and desktop development principles. ... See More

Harry Guajan
[PDF]
Abstract: As a dedicated tutor in EPN's social program, I provided 44 hours of personalized digital training covering hardware/software basics to advanced tools like Office, online banking, and AI. Developed adapted learning materials to ensure effective knowledge transfer for non-technical learners. This initiative demonstrated my ability to simplify complex technological concepts for beginners. I created customized teaching methodologies that allowed my student to progress from zero to autonomous digital transactions. ... See More

About Me

I'm a Computer Engineering student‚Äîan organized person committed to my professional growth. Although I'm still in training, I work every day to improve both my technical and personal skills.

I've discovered that programming goes far beyond writing lines of code; it's a powerful tool for creating solutions that can positively impact people's lives. That's what truly inspires me to keep learning.

In my free time, I enjoy getting lost in the pages of poetry or magical realism, especially the works of Neruda or Garc√≠a M√°rquez. I also love playing soccer with friends whenever I get the chance. I play as a goalkeeper‚ÄîI'm not a professional, but I genuinely enjoy it. Sketching is another one of my hobbies; I do it more for pleasure than for technique, especially when I need to unwind.

A quote that has always inspired me is:

"To see the world, things dangerous to come to, to see behind walls, draw closer, to find each other and to feel. That is the purpose of life."
